function.description: It returns the absolute value of a number. Example: abs(-24)Result: 24
Returns the arc cosine of number. Example: acos(0.25) result: 1.318116071652818
Returns the arc sine of number. Example: asin(0.25) result: 0.25268025514207865
Returns the arc tangent of number. Example: atan(0.25) result: 0.24497866312686414
Returns the arc tangent of given number. Example: atan2(0.50,1) result: 0.4636476090008061
Displays a value rounded to a certain number of decimal places. Example: round(34.4158,2) result: 34.42
Returns number rounded up to the nearest integer. Example: ceiling(0.25) result: 1
Returns the cosine of number. Example: cos(0.25) result: 0.9689124217106447
Returns the cotangent of an angle. Specify the angle in radians. Example: 1/tan(0.25) result: 3.9163173646459399
Converts angle number in radians to degrees. Example: degrees(0.25) result: 14.32394487827058
Returns the integer part of a division operation. Example: (10/5) result: 2
Returns Eulerâ€™s number raised to the power of the given number. Example: exp(2) result: 7.389
Returns number rounded down to the nearest number. Example: floor(3.1415) result: 3
Returns the natural logarithm of number. Example: ln(2) result: 0.6931471805599453
Returns the base 10 logarithm of number. Example: log10(2) result: 0.3010299956639812
Returns the largest of the provided values. Example: greatest(4,13) result: 13
Returns the smallest of the provided values. Example: least(13,4) result: 4
Returns the constant Pi. Example: pi() result: 3.14159
Returns the signum function of number, that is: 0 if the argument is 0, 1 if the argument is greater than 0, -1 if the argument is less than 0. Example: sign(0.5) result: 1.
Returns the sine of number. Example: sin(0.25) result: 0.24740395925452294
Displays the value of a number raised to the power of another number. Example: pow(4,2) result: 16
Converts the value of a number from degrees to radians. Example : radians(4) result : 0.06981317007977318
Displays the square root of a non-negative number. Example: sqrt(5) result: 2.23606797749979
It displays the square of a given number. Example: (4*4) result: 16
Returns the tangent of number. Example: tan(0.25) result: 0.25534192122103627
Displays a number truncated to a certain number of decimal places. Example: truncate(1.289,2) result: 1.28
Returns the Unicode of the first character of string. Example: ASCII('A') result:65
Returns the character encoded by the ASCII code. Example:chr(65) result:A
Returns the number of characters in string. Example : LENGTH('Bengaluru') result:9
Converts all characters in the specified string to lowercase. Example: LOWER('BENGALURU') result: bengaluru
Converts all characters in a string to uppercase. Example: UPPER('bengaluru') result: BENGALURU.
It removes leading and trailing whitespace from string. Example: TRIM(' Bengaluru ') result:Bengaluru
Removes leading whitespace from string. Example: LTRIM(' Bengaluru') result: Bengaluru
Removes trailing whitespace from string. Example: RTRIM('Bengaluru ') result: Bengaluru.
Returns a string consisting of space characters. Example: space(6) result: .
Returns the string, starting at start_position. The first character in the string is position 1. Example : substr('Bengaluru', 2, 5) result: engal
String search for substring and replace it with replacestring. If substring is not found, the string is not changed. Example : REPLACE('bengaluru','b','Z') result : Zengaluru
Returns the rightmost character from the string. Example: right('bengaluru',4) result: 'luru'

Displays a string that is left padded with a specified string to a certain length. If length is less than string, return value is truncated to length characters. Example: LPAD('Wellesley', 14,'Hills') result:HillsWellesley.
Returns the left most characters in a string. Example: LEFT ('Bengaluru', 4) result:Beng.

Returns the starting position of the first instance of substring in string. Positions start with 1. If not found, 0 is returned. Example :position('z','Bengaluru') result : 0, position('aluru' IN 'Bengaluru') result : 5

function.signature: case when(${string} like concat('%',${substring})) then 'true' else 'false' end
function.description: Returns true if the given string endswith specified substring. Example:case when('postgres' like concat('%','res')) then true else false end result: true. Note:Please provide single quotes if you are directly typing the substring value.

function.signature: case when(${string} like concat(${substring},'%')) then 'true' else 'false' end
function.description: Returns true if string starts with substring. Example: case when('bengaluru' like concat('ben','%')) then true else false end result: true. Note:Please provide single quotes if you are directly typing the substring value.

Splits string on delimiter and returns the field index. Field indexes start with 1. If the index is larger than the number of fields, then empty will return Example : SPLIT_PART('Singa$Pore$Benga$Luru', '$', 2) result : Pore
Returns true if the given string contains the specified substring. Example : case when (instr('aluru', 'Bengaluru')> 0 then true else false end result:true
Returns the position of nth occurrence of given substring in a string. Example:instr('calculation','a',1, 2).Result:7

Displays a string that is right padded with a specified string to a certain length. If length is less than string, return value is truncated to length characters.Length must not be negative and padString must not be non-empty. Example:rpad('Wellesley', 15, 'Hills') result : Wellesley Hills .

function.signature: CASE WHEN LENGTH(${string}) <= 15 THEN (SUBSTR(${string}, 15, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 14, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 13, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 12, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 11, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 10, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 9, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 8, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 7, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 6, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 5, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 4, 1 ) || SUBSTR(${string}, 3, 1 )|| SUBSTR(${string}, 2, 1 )|| SUBSTR(${string}, 1, 1 )) ELSE 'STRING OUT OF RANGE' END
function.description: Returns string with the characters in reverse order. Example: REVERSE('Bengaluru') result : urulagneB
Returns the concatenation of string1, string2. Example: CONCAT('Beng','aluru') result : Bengaluru

Returns the specified date with the specified number of interval added to the specified date_part of that date.Example:(date '2014-03-08' + Interval '2' year) result:2016-03-08 00:00:00.000000 supported units:day, month , year.
Returns the difference between date1 and date2 by comparing the provided unit . Example: TIMESTAMPDIFF(month,date '2012-08-16', date '2019-08-16') result: 84.
Returns day of the month for date/datetime (1-31). Example: day(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00')/day(date '2014-03-08')result: 8

function.signature: (case when length('${year}') <> 0 OR length('${month}') <> 0 OR length('${day}') <> 0 then (to_date('${year}' ||to_char (${month},'09') || to_char(${day},'09'),'YYYYMMDD')) else null end)
function.description: Returns a date for given year, month and year values. Example: case when length('2018') greaterthanlessthan 0 OR length('11') greaterthanlessthan 0 OR length('09') greaterthanlessthan 0 then to_date('2018' || to_char('11','09') || to_char('09','09') , 'YYYYMMDD') result: 2018-11-09 00:00:00.000000.Note : Replace greaterthanlessthan with greaterthanlessthan symbol
Truncates the specified date to the accuracy specified by the format(datepart). Example:DATETRUNC(date '2014-03-08','year') result: 2014-01-01
Returns an integer that represents the specified unit of the specified date. Example: extract(year FROM date '2014-03-08') result: 2014. supported unit:YEAR, QUARTER, MONTH , WEEK , DAY
Displays Current date.

Returns the specified datetime with the specified number interval added to the unit of that datetime. Example:date_add(timestamp '2014-03-08 11:10:27',Interval 2 year) result:2016-03-08 11:10:27 supported units:microsecond, second, minute , hour , day , week , month , quarter , year.
Returns the difference between datetime1 and datetime2 with provided unit. Example:TIMESTAMPDIFF(year, timestamp '2008-01-31 09:00:00',timestamp '2007-12-31 23:59:59') result: 1.
Retruns the name of the week day for date/dateTime. Example: TRIM(TO_CHAR(timestamp '2019-07-24 12:25:10', 'DAY')) result: 'WEDNESDAY'

Returns an integer that represents the specified datepart of the specified datetime. Example: extract(year FROM timestamp '2014-03-08 12:32:42') result: 2014. supported date_part:YEAR, QUARTER, MONTH , WEEK , DAY,SECOND, MINUTE, HOUR.
Returns the month of the year for date/dateTime. Example: month(timestamp '2007-02-03 09:00:00')/month(date '2007-02-03') result: 2
Truncates the specified datetime to the accuracy specified by the format(unit). Example:DATE_TRUNC(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:20:19','hour') result: 2014-03-08 12:00:00
Returns the year for date/datetime. Example: year(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00')/year(date '2014-03-08') result: 2014
Returns MONTHNAME from date/datetime.Example: TRIM(TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2014-03-08 09:00:00', 'MONTH')) result: 'MARCH'
Returns the ISO day of the week for date/datetime. The value ranges from 1 (sunday) to 7 (saturday). Example: dayofweek(timestamp '2007-02-03 09:00:00')/dayofweek('2007-02-03') result: 7.
Displays Current date and time. This function equivalent to current_timestamp.

Return a TIMESTAMP format as a string.Example: TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY/MM/DD HH:MI:SS') result:2019/07/20 09:10:20. Example2 : TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY') result:2019. Example3 : TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY-MM') result:2019-07.
Takes a string as input and displays a date in a specific format. Example:to_timestamp(timestamp '2008-01-31 09:00:00','YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS') result: 2008-01-31 00:00:00

function.signature: (case when length('${year}') <> 0 or length('${month}') <> 0 or length('${day}') <> 0 or length('${hour}') <> 0 or length('${minute}') <> 0 or length('${second}') <> 0 then (to_timestamp('${year}' || to_char(${month},'09') || to_char(${day},'09') || to_char(${hour},'09') || to_char(${minute},'09') || to_char(${second},'09'),'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS' )) else null end)
function.description: Returns a datetime that combines a date and time. Example:(case when length('2019') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('08') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('09') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('10') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('30') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('45') lessthangreaterthan 0 then (to_timestamp('2019' || to_char('08','09') || to_char('09','09') || to_char('10','09') || to_char('30','09') || to_char('45','09'),'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS' )) else null end) Result:2019-08-09 10:30:45.000000 Note:replace lessthangreaterthan with symbol.
Returns time value from the hour, minute and seconds.Example: maketime(12,15,30) result:12:15:30
Returns the hour for timestamp. The value ranges from 0 to 23. Example: hour(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:20:19') result: 12
Returns the minute for time. Example: minute(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:20:19') result:20
Returns the second for time. Example: second(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:20:19') result:19
Returns the millisecond of the second for time. Example: microsecond(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:20:19.344') result:344
Returns the quarter of the year for date/datetime. Example: quarter(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00')/quarter(date '2014-03-08') result:1
Returns the ISO week of the year for date/dateTime. The value ranges from 0 to 53. Example: week(date '2014-03-08')/week(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00')result: 9

Cast function converts one datatype to another. Note:All Values should be in single quotes if you are typing the value. Example: CAST('2019-03-22 17:34:03.000' AS varchar) result:2019-03-22 17:34:03.000
Converts value to char type. Example: cast('2015-01-01' AS varchar) result:2015-01-01
This function converts value to a number type. Example: cast(23.3 AS number) result:23

Converts value to TIME type. Format is "HH:MM:SS" (Supported range is from "-838:59:59" to "838:59:59"). Example: CAST('2019-02-12 14:06:10' AS time) RESULTS: 14:06:10. NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing and its data type is "text/date/dateTime/time" type

Converts value to DATE type. Format is "YYYY-MM-DD" (Supported range is from "1000-01-01" to "9999-12-31").Example: CAST('2019-02-12 14:06:10' AS date) RESULTS: 2019-02-12.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing

Converts value to DATETIME type. Format is "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" (Supported range is from "1000-01-01 00:00:00" to "9999-12-31 23:59:59"). Example:CAST('2019-02-12' AS datetime) RESULTS: 2019-02-12 00:00:00.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing
Converts the value to decimal type. Example: cast(23.3 as decimal) result: 23
Returns json as string.
Returns value as a string based on key from json. Example:MAPLOOKUP({"type": "Glazed"},'type') result:Glazed
Returns true when provided value contains in json, otherwise false. Example:MAPCONTAINSVALUE({"type": "Glazed"},'Glazed') result:true.
Returns true when provided key contains in json, otherwise false. Example:MAPCONTAINSKEY({"type": "Glazed"},'type') result:true.
Returns values as a string from json. Example:MAPVALUES({"type": "Glazed"}) result:Glazed.
Returns keys as a string from json. Example:MAPKEYS({"type": "Glazed"}) result:type.
Returns 1 if data is valid otherwise return -1.

Performs a logical conjunction on two expressions. In 'column' paramter we will 'drag column'. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide condition value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR' condition , 'AND' conditions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0.( Note : In such case don't provide anything in 'condition' and 'value' parameter). We will use AND inside IF. Example: IF (creditlim > = 50000 AND creditlim > = 10000), 'Gold', 'silver' )

Inside case we will use when condition. Evaluates each condition from left to right and returns the result when the first condition met. If no condition met return from else if exist, otherwise return null. Example : CASE WHEN Quantity > 30 THEN "The quantity is greater than 30" ELSE "The quantity is under 30" END
Returns from statement_list when condition gets fail.We will use ELSE inside case function. Example: CASE when 50 > 0 then 'true' else 'false'

function.signature: (case when ${column} ${condition} ${value} then ${conditiontrue} when ${elseIfcolumn} ${elseIfcondition} ${elseIfvalue} then ${elseIfconditiontrue} else ${conditionfalse} ${moreconditions} end)
function.description: Evaluates conditions and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. We will use nested condition inside else 'conditiontrue' parameter. Example:case when creditlim > 50000 then 'PLATINUM' else when (creditlim > = 50000) then 'GOLD' else 'SILVER' end

Inside IF we will use AND, OR conditions. Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. In 'column' paramter we will drag column. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR', 'AND' conditions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0 (Note : In such case don't provide anything in 'condition' parameter and 'value' parameter). Example : (Case when (creditlim > 50000) then 'PLATINUM' else 'SILVER' end)
Returns Expr1 if it is not null otherwise return expr2. Example : (coalesce(null, '1234')) Results:'1234'
Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. Example : case when 'washington'like 'W%' then 'true' else 'false' end

Inside WHEN condition we will use ISNULL. Evalutes and returns 'Conditiontrue' if the expression contain Null. Example1 : CASE WHEN 1 ISNULL THEN Conditionfalse. Example2 : CASE WHEN NULL ISNULL THEN Conditiontrue

Evaluates and returns condition is 'true' if condition is 'false'. Example (case when NOT(500 > 1000) =1 then 'true' else 'false' end): result :'true', We will use NOT inside IF Example:if((case when NOT(500 > 1000) =1 then 'true' else 'false' end)='true','ok','notok') results:'ok'

Performs a logical disjunction on two expressions. In 'column' paramter we will drag column. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR' , 'AND' functions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0 in such case don't provide anything in 'condition' and 'value' parameter. We will use OR inside IF. Example : IF (creditlim > = 50000 OR creditlim > = 10000), 'Gold', 'silver' )

Returns 'statement_list' when condition get satisfied . In column paramter we will drag column. In searchcondition parameter provide conditions like (>, =, IS Null etc .,). In value parameter provide value(Note : IS Null used in 'condition' parameter then don't provide anything in 'value' parameter). In moreconditions parameter we will use nested when conditions, Else condition . We will use WHEN inside CASE. Example1 : CASE WHEN 1 > 0 THEN 'one' else 'TWO'. Example2 : CASE WHEN 'Singapore' IS NULL THEN 'Singa' ELSE 'pore'. Example3 : CASE WHEN Washington like '%sh%' THEN 'return washington' else 'NotMatched'

function.signature: (CASE WHEN ${expr} IS NULL THEN '0' ELSE ${expr} end)
function.description: Returns "expression" if it is not null, otherwise returns zero.Example :ZN(null) result :0
Return the day of the month for a given date (1-31). Example: DAYOFMONTH('2008-05-15') result:15
Returns day of the year for a date (range: 1-366) Example: DAYOFYEAR('2008-05-15') result: 136
Returns last day of the corresponding month for a date/datetime value. Example: LAST_DAY('2009-05-18') result: 2009-05-31

Takes a string and a substring of it as arguments, and returns an integer which indicates the position of the first occurrence of the substring within the string. Example:INSTR('Singapore','s') result:1 .
Inserts a substring into a string at a specified position for a certain number of characters. Example: insert('singapore',1,4,'sing') result: singapore
Extracts the date part from the dateTime value. Example: date('2009-05-18 12:02:32') result: 2009-05-18
Returns a character string with each ASCII character converted to uppercase. Example: UPPERB('Ã©tudiant') result: Ã©TUDIANT.
Returns a character string with each ASCII character converted to lowercase. Example: LOWERB('Ã‰TUDIANT') result: Ã‰tudiant.
Capitalizes first letter of each alphanumeric word and puts the rest in lowercase. Example: INITCAP('high speed database') result: High Speed Database.
Returns a VARCHAR that represents the given VARBINARY value in bitstring format. Example: TO_BITSTRING('ab'::BINARY(2)) result: 0110000101100010.
Returns the number of months between two dates. Example: MONTHS_BETWEEN ('03-31-16'::TIMESTAMP, '02-28-16'::TIMESTAMP) result: 1.09677419354839.
Converts a timestamp value from one time zone to another and returns a datetime. Example: NEW_TIME('05-24-12 13:48:00', 'EST', 'PST') result: 2012-05-24 10:48:00.
An INTEGER value to convert to hexadecimal. Example: TO_HEX(123456789) result: 75bcd15.
Converts the datetime to string
Converts the time to string
Converts the date to string

Converts the number,date,dateTime,time to string.Eg:CAST(120) RESULTS:'120'.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing and its data type is "text/date/dateTime/time" type

Converts the number,date,dateTime,time to string.Eg:CAST(120) RESULTS:'120'.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing and its data type is "text/date/dateTime/time" type
